intro: Scorzonera lindbergii, commonly known as Lindberg's scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Compositae (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and yellow flowers with prominent central disk. The plant produces a tuberous root that is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Scorzonera lindbergii thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often growing at high altitudes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
